intro: Cuphea lindmaniana, commonly known as the firecracker plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lythraceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its striking, tubular, red-orange flowers that resemble firecrackers, hence its common name. The plant is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Cuphea lindmaniana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant floral display.
